oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bird's eye view, 1912
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of an aerial view of downtown Nashville in 1912. Identifiable buildings include the State Capitol, Polk-Wautauga (sic) Apartments, Hermitage Hotel, Stahlman Building, First National Bank, Methodist Publishing House, and the Custom House and Post Office. Broadway runs through the lower right side of the image. Forms part of the Norton Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee State Capitol (Nashville, Tenn.); Polk-Watauga Apartments (Nashville, Tenn.); Hermitage Hotel (Nashville, Tenn.); The Stahlman Building (Nashville, Tenn.); First National Bank (Nashville, Tenn.); Methodist Publishing House; United States Post Office (Nashville, Tenn.); United States Custom House (Nashville, Tenn.)
